moves.1. e4: This is by far the most popular opening move.
moves.1... e5 2. f4: I personally don't like playing against the kings gambit. The centre usually belongs to white although you may have an extra pawn or not.
moves.2... exf4: exf4 if probably the best option. Second best would be d5
moves.3. Nf3: Most popular and less riskiest ( Not sure if that is even a word) kings gambit continuation. This move prevent Qh4+
moves.3... h6: This is the Beckers defense. The idea is that it will support a g5 thrust and controls the aggressive square g5 for the knight.
moves.4. Bc4: Continues to add pressure on f7. Any moment he can play Ne5
moves.4... d6: I have strong dark squares but weak light squares.
moves.6. d3: Pretty strange move. The idea was probably that he didn't want me to take on e6 with my pawn and play e5 with a nice pawn chain.
moves.6... Bxc4 7. dxc4 g5: Protects the pawn. Notice how I've barely made any moves apart from pawn moves and exchanges.
moves.13. Kh1 Qxc3 14. Nxc3 Nd4 15. Rd1 Nxc2 1: he drops another pawn. I'm now 2 pawns up.
moves.20... Bb4 21. Nf6+ Kh8: Kg7 may have been better here.
moves.22. Rxd8 Rxd8 23. g4: Must've made a pawn move or Rd1+ #
moves.23... Rd1+ 24. Kg2 Ne1+ 25. Kf2 Nd3+: Wins a piece or forces the exchange of more pieces. I'll be bishop and 2 pawns vs knight.
